usefulItems: wire rack, baking paper, cling film, pastry brush, cocktail stick, 12 hole madeleine tray, refrigerator, oven
title: Lemon Drizzle Madeleines

ingredients.content: 3 lemons, finely grated zest of 1 and freshly squeezed juice of 3
100 g plain flour, plus extra for dusting

preparations.content: Place butter in mixing bowl and melt <b>2 min 30 sec/80°C/speed 2<b>. Brush insides of a 12 hole madeleine tray with melted butter then dust each hole with a little flour and tap out any excess. Place in fridge to chill until needed. Transfer remaining butter to a small bowl and set aside.
<b>Insert butterfly whisk<b>. Place caster sugar, eggs, lemon zest and juice of 1 lemon in mixing bowl then whisk <b>5 min/37°C/speed 3<b>.

Add flour, baking powder and reserved melted butter then mix <b>10 sec/speed 2<b>. Scrape down sides of mixing bowl with spatula then mix again <b>5 sec/speed 2<b>. Cover mixing bowl with cling film and place in fridge to chill for 4 hours.
Towards the end of this time, preheat oven to 180°C and place a sheet of baking paper under a wire rack.

Place mixing bowl back into position and re-mix rested batter <b>5 sec/speed 2<b>. <b>Remove butterfly whisk<b>. Fill holes of cold madeleine tray ⅔ full. Bake for 10 minutes (180°C) or until well-risen and golden. Leave to cool in tray for 2 minutes then transfer madeleines to prepared wire rack.

In a small bowl, mix together granulated sugar and juice of remaining 2 lemons until just combined. Prick madeleines all over with a cocktail stick then carefully spoon over lemon mixture. Leave to cool completely before serving.
